p: There are three main classes of disposable bioreactors described in the litearure: (1) mechanically driven, (2) hydraulically driven and (3) pneumatically driven systems [ 162]. Mechanically driven disposable bioreactors are most often used due to their scalability and good investigation. Mixing in disposable bioreactors is performed by rotating and tumbling stirrers, vibrating perforated disks, rocking and rising platforms, or orbitally shaken platforms ( Figure 6).
